#Text=Write a Trading Plan
#Text=Writing a trading plan is an integral part of being a successful market trader .
#Text=Whether trading stocks , currencies or commodities , a detailed trading plan helps to solidify a trading strategy and encourages adherence to a well-developed trading system .
#Text=An effective trading plan details the steps that a trader must follow when entering and exiting trades .
#Text=Without a trading plan in place , traders are more susceptible to trading mistakes , overtrading and making impulsive decisions in volatile markets , particularly when trading online .
#Text=Here are the steps for writing a trading plan .
#Text=Steps
#Text=At the very first place , you have to decide which financial instruments you will trade .
#Text=You may be strictly a stock or currency trader , or you may be trading multiple markets .
#Text=So , try to create a separate category in your trading plan for each financial instrument .
#Text=It is necessary to check the market asset volatility before selecting a particular asset type .
#Text=For example , in the forex market , if you want to trade exotic pair , then you have to pay a higher spread compared to the major pairs .
#Text=Determine which stocks , currencies or other financial instruments to trade .
#Text=For example , you may be interested in a few company stocks .
#Text=Or when trading currencies , you might trade only one currency pair or all pairs related to the Great British Pound ( GBP ) .
#Text=List the names of the specific companies , currencies or commodities .
#Text=Identify your market indicators .
#Text=For example , you might trade a particular currency based on a series of chart indicators related to momentum , moving averages , and trend lines .
#Text=Write down the exact conditions that must be met before you can enter a particular trade .
#Text=Remember , trading indicators will help you to analyze the trading market properly .
#Text=Decide ahead of time how many shares or lots you will purchase .
#Text=Thinking through the trading size ahead of time will help you to avoid taking risks that may result in tremendous loss .
#Text=Record the number of shares or lots you intend to purchase .
#Text=Do not overtrade .
#Text=Set specific price entry points .
#Text=Your goal may be to buy a particular stock when it reaches a specific price .
#Text=Write down at which price you will buy the stock , plus or minus a few points , if applicable .
#Text=Write down the process of how you will monitor each trade .
#Text=When day trading , for example , you might check the price of your stock or currency every 15 minutes .
#Text=Or you might set an alarm to alert you to these time increments .
#Text=Monitoring each trade can help you to avoid extra loss in trading .
#Text=Decide on the parameters for trade exits .
#Text=Documenting your exact strategy for trade exits prevents last-minute or impulsive trading decisions , such as exiting a trade too early or holding it for too long .
#Text=If you have a well-tested and profitable trading system with a strict money management plan , exiting your trade based on set parameters will yield the best results .
#Text=Write the exact conditions that must be met before you can exit your trade .
#Text=This may be an exact price point , a chart indicator level or a specific time of day .
#Text=Include a section for trading times .
#Text=If trading the 24-hour foreign exchange market , trading can be a nonstop event .
#Text=Decide on a trading schedule and write it into your trading plan .
#Text=When day trading stocks , you might work for 4 hours each day starting at the daily open .
#Text=If you trade in longer time frames , your trading schedule may involve only a 15-minute daily commitment to check prices and read relevant market news .
#Text=Evaluate your trading plan .
#Text=Include a section in your trading plan for evaluating your trades .
#Text=This can be a comment box where you write down whether you adhered to your trading plan .
#Text=Alternatively , it may be a list of steps you must check off while trading .
#Text=The trading plan can be changed based on the market price movement .
#Text=Note that your plan will help you to be a successful trader .
